This app demonstrates:

1. A simple layout with a sidebar containing controls and a main content area
2. An action link that can be updated
3. A button to trigger updates to the action link
4. A text input to customize the link's label
5. A counter showing how many times the link has been clicked
6. Cycling through different icons when updating the link

The app features:
- Dynamic updates to both label and icon of the action link
- Reactive tracking of link clicks
- User input for custom labels
- Cycling through different icons on each update
- Clean layout using Bootstrap-based Shiny components

To use the app:
1. Enter custom text in the "Custom link label" input
2. Click the "Update link label and icon" button to update the action link
3. Click the action link to increment its counter
4. Notice how the icon changes each time you update the link

Installation:
```bash
pip install shiny
```

Run the app with:
```bash
shiny run app.py
```

This example follows Shiny for Python's express mode conventions and best practices, using only built-in components and avoiding external dependencies.
